intro: Calycera squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa calycera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Namibia. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely grown outside its native range.
